definitions.definition: to put a dead body into the ground:
examples: His father is buried in the cemetery on the hill.

definitions.definition: to put something into a hole in the ground and cover it:
examples: The dog trotted off to bury its bone.

definitions.definition: to cover something or someone completely with a large quantity of something:
examples: If an avalanche strikes, skiers can be buried alive by snow.

definitions.definition: to put something in a place where it is difficult or impossible to find or see:
examples: I found the article buried (away) in the business section of the newspaper.

definitions.definition: to intentionally forget an unpleasant experience:
examples: He'd had to bury his pain over the years.

definitions.definition: If someone says they buried someone, usually a close relation, they mean that the person died:
examples: She buried both her parents last year.
